hint.text:
Given first term and common difference, use the general \(n^{th}\) term equation of A.P.
\(a_n=a+(n-1)d\)

solution.text:
General \(n^{th}\) term of an A.P.
\(a_n=a+(n-1)d\)
Given
a=_{p}_ , d=_{q}_ and n=_{s}_
substitution values into \(n^{th}\) term equation
\(a_ _{s}_=_{p}_+(_{s}_-1)_{q}_\)
\(a_ _{s}_=_{p}_ +(_{{s-1}}_)_{q}_\)
\(a_ _{s}_=_{{p+(s-1)*q}}_\)

content.text: Find the _{s}_\(^{th}\) term of an A.P. whose first term and common difference are _{p}_ and _{q}_ ,respectively
